FuncDef:
The max-ipuser-reauthtime command sets the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.
The undo max-ipuser-reauthtime command restores the maximum reauthentication time of a domain to the default value.
By default, the maximum reauthentication time of a domain is 300 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum reauthentication time of a domain.
The value ranges from 0 to 65535, in seconds. Value 0 indicates that re-authentication is not triggered.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a pre-domain user (Layer-3 pre-connection user) has not passed authentication within the re-authentication timeout period, the NE40E disconnects this user.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
If the re-authentication timeout period is less than 180 seconds, users may be logged out.
